oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Proline-derived organocatalysis and synergism between theory and experiments
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SUNOJ, RB
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ASYMMETRIC ALDOL REACTIONS
MANNICH-TYPE REACTIONS
ENANTIOSELECTIVE MICHAEL ADDITION
DENSITY-FUNCTIONAL THEORY
AMINO-ACID-DERIVATIVES
DIELS-ALDER REACTIONS
ONE-POT
ALPHA,BETA-UNSATURATED ALDEHYDES
ALPHA-AMINO
INCREASED REACTIVITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The ability of proline and its derivatives toward catalyzing asymmetric organic reactions is highlighted. Illustration of the impact of interdisciplinary efforts between computational and experimental research is provided through a number of interesting examples. (C) 2011 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd. WIREs Comput Mol Sci 2011 1 920-931 DOI: 10.1002/wcms.37
